info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 1:17AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN COLUMBIANA... NORTHERN BEAVER...LAWRENCE AND WEST CENTRAL BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 145 AM EDT... At 117 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Columbiana, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Cranberry, New Castle, Beaver Falls, Columbiana, East Palestine, Ellwood City, New Brighton, Zelienople, Lisbon, Oakwood, New Castle Northwest, and New Waterford. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 1 and 25. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 85 and 107. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 9 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
